channel.title: Dave's linkblog feed
channel.description: My linkblog has been around in various locations for many years.

item.description: We all have been raised to believe that "getting ahead" is the thing to do with our lives. It's deeply ingrained over many generations. We're still doing that, even though the three big crises we're going to be dealing with for the rest of our lives, demand a different approach -- "working together."
item.source:markdown: We all have been raised to believe that "getting ahead" is the thing to do with our lives. It's deeply ingrained over many generations. We're still doing that, even though the three big crises we're going to be dealing with for the rest of our lives, demand a different approach -- "working together."

item.description: Apparently Ghost is working on feed reading, they need this to be part of the fediverse, to be two-way -- ie not just cross-posting.

item.description: "Social web" is not the same thing as ActivityPub. Another appropriation of the term "web." ActivityPub is not finished and it's too complicated to be the foundation of anything given such a large title. The beauty of the web is its simplicity. And there are other formats and protocols that predate AP that are also foundations of the social web.
item.source:markdown: "Social web" is not the same thing as ActivityPub. Another appropriation of the term "web." ActivityPub is not finished and it's too complicated to be the foundation of anything given such a large title. The beauty of the web is its simplicity. And there are other formats and protocols that predate AP that are also foundations of the social web.

item.description: Credit where it’s due: WaPo has already published two stories this week that attempt to cover Trump like the conman he is, rather than the good faith politician he is often treated as.
item.source:markdown: Credit where it’s due: WaPo has already published two stories this week that attempt to cover Trump like the conman he is, rather than the good faith politician he is often treated as.

item.description: Social networks are condemned when they carry lies from race-hate, misogyny and worse, but the major news orgs do it all the time. It's ridiculous that there are two standards.

item.description: Dear NYT how about recording the number of times each candidate openly threatens specific races, genders, lifestyles, religions and of course individual people. Keep a page where you tally. Point to it frequently (we will).
item.source:markdown: Dear NYT how about recording the number of times each candidate openly threatens specific races, genders, lifestyles, religions and of course individual people. Keep a page where you tally. Point to it frequently (we will).

item.description: Throwing a wrench into the already broken wheels of our medical system is the crime. They should go to prison for doing this, the six Supreme Court justices and other Republican assholes who stick their noses where they don't belong.
item.source:markdown: Throwing a wrench into the already broken wheels of our medical system is the crime. They should go to prison for doing this, the six Supreme Court justices and other Republican assholes who stick their noses where they don't belong.

item.description: "We're not taking them from infested countries." -- hard to believe this is someone who many people feel is qualified to be president of the United States.

item.description: Jules Feiffer was just interviewed on NPR. He's 95 years old, and sharp as can be. Born the same year as my father, 1929 -- he died in 2009.
item.source:markdown: Jules Feiffer was just interviewed on NPR. He's 95 years old, and sharp as can be. Born the same year as my father, 1929 -- he died in 2009.

item.description: It’d be nice if there were a toolkit for Bluesky that made it easy to embed in other server apps with established and different UIs. We’ve been stuck with the twitter model since 2006.
item.source:markdown: It’d be nice if there were a toolkit for Bluesky that made it easy to embed in other server apps with established and different UIs. We’ve been stuck with the twitter model since 2006.
